articles.title: Hemi: Bridging Bitcoin's Security and Ethereum's Programmability
articles.description:
This is really a huge innovation building on two top blockchains in the space. Hemi is creating a network that takes Bitcoinâ€™s unmatched security and combines it with Ethereumâ€™s flexibility for building apps. Using its Proof-of-Proof system, Hemi locks transactions to Bitcoin, making them extra secure while still letting developers build powerful DeFi projects.

Hemi delivers transactions are as secure as the Bitcoin chain itself. The networkâ€™s tech stack the Hemi Virtual Machine (hVM) and Hemi Bitcoin Kit (hBK) lets developers build powerful DeFi apps that tap into Bitcoinâ€™s liquidity without sacrificing programmability. After an incentivized testnet that processed over 20 million transactions, Hemiâ€™s mainnet went live in March 2025 and the momentum hasnâ€™t slowed.

articles.title: Show HN: Captan â€“ Open-Source Cap Table Management CLI
articles.description:
I built Captan (https://github.com/acossta/captan), a tiny open-source CLI tool for managing startup cap tables.

Instead of juggling spreadsheets or paying for expensive SaaS cap table solutions, Captan stores everything in a simple JSON file that you can version-control in Git.

It supports:

- Stakeholders (founders, employees, investors)

- Security classes (Common, Preferred, Option Pool)

- Share issuances

- Option grants with vesting schedules (monthly, cliff)

- SAFEs (record + simulate conversion at a priced round)

- Cap table math (Outstanding vs Fully Diluted)

- CSV/JSON exports

- Audit log ("the shipâ€™s log")

Overall a JSON in git will offer better auditability and version control than most commercial solutions out there.

Modeling different scenarios is super easy, just create a git branch and model whatever you need.

Quick taste:

---------------------------------------

npm install -g captan

$captan init --name "Acme, Inc." --pool-pct 20

$captan enlist stakeholder --name "Alice Founder"

$captan issue --security sc_common --holder sh_alice --qty 5000000

$captan chart

Example output:

Captan â€” Cap Table (as of today)

Name Outstanding %

Alice Founder 5000000 100.00%

Totals

Issued equity: 5000000

Vested options: 0

Outstanding total: 5000000

Fully diluted total: 7000000

---------------------------------------

Why I built it: early-stage founders (myself included) often donâ€™t need Carta or Pulley yet â€” just a clean, hackable way to track ownership. I wanted something transparent, developer-friendly, and Git-native.

Repo: https://github.com/acossta/captan

npm: https://www.npmjs.com/package/captan

Iâ€™d love feedback on what features would make this more useful to you?

Thanks!
